happy_paths.name: Successful Onboarding & First Deposit
steps: Customer expresses interest in a leveraged account, often by clicking 'Hablar con un Agente'.
Agent confirms interest and provides a standard information package about the 'Cuentas Apalancadas X12'.
Customer asks clarifying questions about rules, minimum deposit amounts, and withdrawal conditions.
Agent guides the customer through the registration and document verification process.
Customer confirms registration and asks how to deposit funds.
Agent explains deposit methods (PSE, Card, Crypto) and their respective processing times.
Agent guides the customer to use the 'Amplify' feature on the platform to multiply their capital.
Agent provides MT5 server details and instructions to link the newly created account.
Customer successfully links their account and is ready to trade.

happy_paths.name: Successful Withdrawal Process
steps: Customer makes a profit and asks how to withdraw funds.
Agent provides a link to the withdrawal guide and explains the process is done via the 'Amplify' section.
Customer transfers profits from the MT5 account to their main platform wallet.
Customer adds their crypto wallet address and initiates the withdrawal.
Withdrawal is processed and received in the customer's crypto wallet.

deviations.name: Beginner Trader Identified
deviations.description: The customer reveals they have little or no trading experience. The agent identifies that the leveraged account product is for experienced traders and pivots the conversation to offer an educational product (e.g., Premium Academy).
deviations.trigger: Customer states they are new, want to learn, or have no experience (e.g., 'Soy nuevo', 'Quiero aprender', 'No hecho nunca trading').

deviations.name: Deposit Failure or Complication
deviations.description: The customer's attempt to deposit funds fails. This is often due to card rejections, high card processing fees that deter the user, or difficulties navigating the crypto deposit process.
deviations.trigger: Customer reports a failed transaction, questions deposit fees, or expresses confusion about crypto wallets (e.g., 'No me deja depositar', 'me cobran 30 dólares de comisión', 'Que cosa tan complicada').

deviations.name: Withdrawal Delay
deviations.description: A customer successfully initiates a withdrawal, but the funds do not appear in their crypto wallet in the expected timeframe. The agent's role shifts to reassurance and directing the customer to official support channels ('Apoyo').
deviations.trigger: Customer states that their withdrawal has been pending for several hours or is not reflected in their wallet (e.g., 'hice el retiro y no ha cargado', 'no se ve reflejado').

deviations.name: Bonus Account Confusion
deviations.description: The customer inquires about a 'free account' or 'bonus account' they saw in an advertisement, often believing it requires no initial deposit. The agent must clarify that the bonus account is a gift contingent on purchasing a real leveraged account.
deviations.trigger: Customer asks to claim their 'cuenta grátis' or 'bono sin depósito'.

deviations.name: Technical Trading Issue
deviations.description: The customer has successfully set up their account but is unable to place trades on MT5. The issue is consistently resolved by instructing them to add a '.f' suffix to the asset symbol (e.g., 'XAUUSD.f').
deviations.trigger: Customer reports 'trade is disabled' or that they cannot open a position (e.g., 'No me dejó operar').

deviations.name: Login or Account Access Problem
deviations.description: The customer is unable to log in to the platform after registering, often due to incorrect password, verification issues, or platform errors. The agent typically needs to escalate to support for a resolution.
deviations.trigger: Customer states they cannot log in or that their credentials are not working (e.g., 'No me deja entrar con mi mail', 'Error').

deviations.name: Unqualified or Junk Conversation
deviations.description: The conversation contains no meaningful user input, is spam, appears to be a wrong number, or the user explicitly states they are not interested. These conversations are non-productive.
deviations.trigger: Initial messages are 'null' or 'undefined' with no follow-up, contain spam links, or are personal messages indicating a wrong number.
